localize.text: It’s been quite a while since your first encounter with the Abnormalities.
I guess you've become a bit more familiar with them.
Let me ask you again. What do you think Abnormalities are?
Oh please, don’t say you still believe that Abnormalities are just bizarre alien creatures and that we need to isolate them.
Abnormalities are not the evil monsters you read about in old fairy tales.
It isn't a supernatural god that will judge our sins.
There is an old river that has been flowing at the very bottom of the world for many ages.
It’s the source of everything but has been forgotten by mankind.
Nobody knew of its existence, but somewhere in the world, there is a very small gap, or hole, through which the river is connected.
Often, strange creatures came out of that gap from the Black Forest.
Obviously, the number was insufficient for the Lobotomy Corporation's energy needs.
Our new technology does not produce energy from the Abnormalities.
Rather, it creates Abnormalities.
Their forms were incomplete because they came from a forgotten place; we were scared of them because they were incomplete. It is because of that terror that they have been sealed underground.
However, Abnormalities are part of the seed. That's what I meant by "possibility."
The seed is not something that can be made in just a day, or be created on its own.
We realized if we wanted to fix a broken system we couldn't just sit around in a sunny spot, waiting for the clouds to part.
What should we do after planting the seeds?
We can’t control the entire process, we have to leave them to sprout on their own.
Aren't we allowed that much hope at least?
